page.title: 02Changing Times in Abingdon
page.content: Local people who have lived in the area between 14 and 33 years were interviewed. The main change, they agreed, was from a rural community to an urban one. The majority of the area had been farmland with no major landmarks. The development of the bypass and housing estates, particularly Peachcroft, changed the area dramatically. The College of Further Education was extended and the number of primary schools was increased. Many jobs were within easy travelling distance. Generally life had improved but it was felt development should now stop and more recreational facilities should be provided.
